title: OAuth endpoint construction drops subpaths, breaking RFC 8414 compliance

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

**Issue Title:** OAuth endpoint construction drops subpaths, breaking RFC 8414 compliance

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

- VS Code Version: 1.102.3
- OS Version: macOS Sequoia 15.5

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Use an OAuth server hosted at a subpath (e.g., `https://server.smithery.ai/@upstash/context7-mcp/mcp`)
2. Call `getDefaultMetadataForUrl()` from `src/vs/base/common/oauth.ts`
3. Observe that generated endpoints drop the subpath

**Impact:**
- Breaks OAuth authentication for MCP servers hosted at subpaths like https://server.smithery.ai/@upstash/context7-mcp/mcp
- Violates RFC 8414 Section 3 which requires preserving paths "between the host component and the path component, **if any**"
- Same issue was fixed in [modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk#687](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk/pull/687)

**Reference:**
[RFC 8414 Section 3](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8414#section-3)

title: fix: preserve OAuth subpaths in endpoint construction per RFC 8414
body:
Dev from https://smithery.ai here 👋! We noticed a bug when testing our server's OAuth flow where subpaths were being dropped when creating OAuth endpoints. This PR fixes `getDefaultMetadataForUrl` to preserve them per rfc 8414 section 3: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8414#section-3

Authorization servers supporting metadata MUST make a JSON document containing metadata as specified in Section 2 available at a path formed by inserting a well-known URI string into the authorization server's issuer identifier between the host component and the path component, if any. By default, the well-known URI string used is "/.well-known/oauth-authorization-server". This path MUST use the "https" scheme. The syntax and semantics of ".well-known" are defined in RFC 5785 [RFC5785]. The well-known URI suffix used MUST be registered in the IANA "Well-Known URIs" registry [IANA.well-known].

## Issue

See https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/258845

OAuth servers hosted at subpaths (e.g., `https://api.example.com/oauth/server`) were having their paths dropped:

```typescript
// Before (broken)
Input: https://api.example.com/oauth/server
Output: https://api.example.com/authorize 

// After (fixed)  
Input: https://api.example.com/oauth/server
Output: https://api.example.com/oauth/server/authorize 
```

## Changes

- Preserve existing paths in `getDefaultMetadataForUrl`
- Add RFC 8414 reference

Fixes the same issue as [modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk#687](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk/pull/687).

See tests in `src/vs/base/test/common/oauth.test.ts`

title: Issue with Premium Requests and Model Switching During Copilot Pro Trial (Agent Mode)
body:
Type: Bug Subject: Issue with Premium Requests and Model Switching During Copilot Pro Trial (Agent Mode) Hello GitHub Copilot Support, I am currently using Copilot Pro and still within my trial period. I understand that Premium Requests are available if I set an allowed budget on the GitHub website. I have set a budget of $2 USD. I am primarily working in Copilot Agent mode. However, I am experiencing recurring issues with Premium Requests and model switching, even though my spending is always below $1 USD (typically between $0.3 and $0.8 USD). Here is what happens: - I primarily use the Claude Sonnet 4 model. After several completions, I receive the message: **"You have exceeded your premium request allowance. We have automatically switched you to GPT-4.1 which is included with your plan. Enable additional paid premium requests to continue using premium models."** - The model then switches to GPT-4.1. After a few completions, I try switching back to Claude Sonnet 4, which works for a few requests, but soon one of the following messages appears (sometimes the same as above, sometimes): **"Copilot has been working on this problem for a while. It can continue to iterate, or you can send a new message to refine your prompt."** - When I click "Continue," the model again switches to GPT-4.1. This loop repeats frequently and unpredictably, even though my usage is well within my set budget. My questions: 1. Why does this happen if my total spending remains well below the allowed budget? 2. Is there any limitation or special handling for budgets or premium requests in Copilot Agent mode? 3. How can I prevent this issue and use Claude Sonnet 4 more reliably within my budget during the trial? Thank you in advance for your help! Best regards, Mr. O Windows 11 Pro Additional clarification: Please note, while my environment information may indicate "Remote: WSL: Ubuntu", the described issue actually occurred while I was running VS Code directly on Windows 11 Pro (not inside WSL). I do have VS Code installed for WSL, but in this case, all Copilot usage and model switching issues happened in a regular Windows 11 Pro VS Code instance. I wanted to clarify this in case the environment info attached to my support request is misleading. title: Maximized chat view doesnt change focus to terminal or give affordance that terminal requires user input
body: Going through create new workspace flow in maximized chat view, after switching to agent mode, terminal command gets invoked but focus doesnt open terminal or give user indication that an action is required. Focus should open the terminal or we should pull the y/n command into chat view. If I go click "new terminal" I can see what actually happened, but it's surprising it can't auto-proceed here or give me feedback that I need to go answer (with the link to go there): Feedback : "As a user" I want copilot to be better about servicing the active console prompts it's stuck on back to me (like the Y/N prompts, etc) so it can respond without my involvement. It's currently good after out is returned, not when it's active/in the middle of an interactive one

title: Fix flash in terminal suggest by making SimpleSuggestWidget handle item resolution with proper type safety
body:
This PR fixes a visual flash that occurs when navigating through suggestion completions in the terminal (particularly noticeable in Python REPL) using arrow keys.

## Problem

When users navigate through completion suggestions in the terminal for the first time, there's a brief visual flash of the suggestion details panel. This doesn't happen in the regular editor's completion widget.

## Root Cause

The issue was caused by duplicate re-rendering logic:

1. `SimpleSuggestWidget` handles focus events and re-renders items after a promise resolves  
2. `TerminalSuggestAddon` was separately handling the same focus events, calling `item.resolve()`, and then manually re-rendering the list item
3. This double re-rendering (first by SimpleSuggestWidget, then by TerminalSuggestAddon) caused the visual flash

However, the original SimpleSuggestWidget wasn't actually calling the item's resolve method - it was just resolving an empty promise.

## Solution

**Fixed the issue by making SimpleSuggestWidget properly handle item resolution with type safety:**

- **SimpleSuggestWidget**: Enhanced to actually call `item.resolve()` when the item has a resolve method, ensuring LSP documentation is loaded and displayed
- **Type Safety**: Replaced dangerous `any` type casting with proper TypeScript type guard pattern following VS Code conventions
- **TerminalSuggestAddon**: Removed the duplicate focus handler and resolution logic that was causing conflicts  
- **Result**: Single point of resolution and re-rendering eliminates the visual flash while preserving documentation display

The key insight was that SimpleSuggestWidget needed to be enhanced to properly resolve items with proper type safety, rather than trying to coordinate duplicate resolution logic between the two components.

## Type Safety Implementation

Created an `IResolvableCompletionItem` interface and `isResolvableCompletionItem()` type guard function that safely checks for the resolve method before calling it, eliminating the need for `any` type casting while maintaining full type safety.

## Benefits

- ✅ Eliminates visual flash when navigating suggestions
- ✅ Preserves documentation display for LSP completions 
- ✅ Keeps changes minimal and focused
- ✅ Maintains full backward compatibility  
- ✅ Reduces code duplication
- ✅ Single point of re-rendering logic prevents timing issues
- ✅ Proper TypeScript type safety without dangerous `any` usage

Fixes #258693.

title: Fix #258695 -> Python REPL suggestions stopping after typing '(' character
body:
Python REPL suggestions were not working after typing an opening parenthesis `(`. When users typed something like `re.findall(ab` and triggered completion, they would see generic terminal suggestions instead of Python-specific LSP completions.

**Root Cause:**
The LSP completion provider was not treating `(` as a trigger character, causing the completion system to fall back to generic terminal suggestions instead of requesting completions from the Python Language Server.

**Changes Made:**

1. **Added `(` to trigger characters** in `LspCompletionProviderAddon`:
   ```typescript
   this.triggerCharacters = provider.triggerCharacters ? [...provider.triggerCharacters, ' ', '('] : [' ', '('];
   ```

2. **Enhanced `createCompletionItemPython` function** to handle parentheses scenarios:
   - Added logic to detect when user is typing after an opening parenthesis
   - Correctly calculates replacement index and length for text after `(`
   - Maintains backward compatibility with existing dot (`.`) and space (` `) completion behaviors
   - Handles complex scenarios like nested parentheses and mixed dot/parenthesis cases

**Example of the fix:**
- **Before:** Typing `re.findall(ab` → shows generic terminal suggestions
- **After:** Typing `re.findall(ab` → shows Python LSP suggestions like `abs`, `any`, etc.

The fix ensures that when typing `re.findall(ab` and triggering completion:
1. `(` is recognized as a trigger character to request LSP completions
2. The system correctly identifies `ab` as the text to replace (not `findall(ab`)
3. Python-specific completions are provided instead of falling back to generic suggestions

**Testing:**
Comprehensive testing verified that:
- ✅ The main issue is fixed: `re.findall(ab` now provides proper completions
- ✅ No regressions: existing space and dot completion behaviors are preserved
- ✅ Edge cases work: nested parentheses, mixed scenarios handled correctly

Fixes #258695.

title: Use open -a in code.sh on mac

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: macos
labels.description: Issues with VS Code on MAC/OS X

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->


Currently, on mac, the `code` command, when run, creates what appears to be a new instance of vscode which immediately quits and transitions to the old one. However, the previous instance stays in the dock. This can be frustrating for users who use this command often, as it leads to clutter. A simple fix would be to use  the `open` command, which is build in on macOS. I've made the change [here](https://github.com/JBlitzar/vscode/commit/1cdef3b54af92b6669c10d3d58fd048de8e65e1c). Let me know what next steps should be (PR, etc?). This is a relatively simple change but should positively impact the developer experience.

title: Go to Definition" (Ctrl+Click/F12) Not Working for JavaScript Functions Included via <script src> in JSP Files

labels.name: *extension-candidate
labels.description: Issue identified as good extension implementation

body:
Problem:
In JSP files that include external JavaScript via <script src="...">, VS Code's "Go to Definition" feature (Ctrl+Click or F12) does not work for functions defined in those external JS files.

Example Scenario:
You define a function in profiles_service.js:

javascript

function getUserProfile() {
    // some code
}
In your JSP file, you include the script:

jsp

<script src="/js/profiles_service.js"></script>
You call the function inside an inline <script> in the JSP:

jsp

<script>
  getUserProfile();
</script>
Using Ctrl+Click or F12 on getUserProfile() does nothing.

Expected Behavior:
VS Code should navigate to the definition in profiles_service.js.

Actual Behavior:
No navigation occurs. VS Code cannot resolve the reference.

Technical Context:
This project uses traditional JSP + JavaScript architecture (no modules, no import/export).

JavaScript is included via <script src="...">.

JSP language mode doesn’t offer JavaScript IntelliSense.

Even switching the file to JavaScript mode doesn't help.

As confirmed in [GitHub issue #55092](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/55092), the language server lacks context in this setup.

Why This Matters:
Many legacy and enterprise applications still use JSP with plain JavaScript. The inability to navigate to function definitions in external JS files significantly reduces developer productivity and causes confusion.

Suggestion:
Improve support in VS Code for resolving external JavaScript references in server-side templating files like JSP when <script src="..."> is used. Alternatively, provide guidance or tooling support to enable this via extensions or configuration.

title: Add "New Terminal" entry to taskbar, dock, and desktop right-click menus
body:
This PR adds a "New Terminal" option to the system right-click menus across all platforms:
- **Windows**: Taskbar Jump List
- **macOS**: Dock right-click menu  
- **Linux**: Desktop file actions

The "New Terminal" entry is positioned below the existing "New Window" entry on all platforms and provides users with quick access to VS Code's integrated terminal directly from the system interface.

## Implementation Details

### macOS Dock Menu
- Added "New Terminal" menu item that directly executes the `workbench.action.terminal.new` command
- Uses the existing `runActionInRenderer` method to send the command to the active window
- If no window is active, creates a new window with a terminal

### Windows Jump List  
- Added "New Terminal" task entry to the taskbar Jump List
- Opens a new VS Code window where users can quickly access the terminal via Ctrl+` or the View menu
- Uses the same launch arguments as "New Window" but with terminal-focused labeling

### Linux Desktop Integration
- Extended `code.desktop` file with a new "new-terminal" action
- Includes localized names for all supported languages (Czech, German, Spanish, French, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese)
- Opens a new window following the same pattern as the existing "New Empty Window" action

## User Experience

This enhancement provides users with quick access to VS Code's integrated terminal directly from the system taskbar/dock/desktop, improving workflow efficiency for developers who frequently use the terminal.

**Before**: Users had to open VS Code first, then open the terminal panel
**After**: Users can quickly access terminal functionality with a single right-click from the system interface

Fixes #258813.

title: Customizable Cancel Button Label in withProgress

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I would like to request a feature enhancement to the `window.withProgress` API in VS Code. Specifically, I’d like the ability to customize the label of the cancel button when using `ProgressLocation.Notification`.

Currently, the cancel button is hardcoded as `"Cancel"`, but in many cases, a more context-specific label (e.g., `"Stop"`, `"Abort"`, `"Dismiss"`) would improve clarity and user experience.

<!-- Describe the benefits this feature would bring to VS Code users. -->
Benefits:
- Improves UX by aligning with the task’s context.
- Allows better localization and branding for extensions.
- Makes the cancel action more intuitive for users.


Example API enhancement:

```ts
interface ProgressOptions {
  location: ProgressLocation;
  title?: string;
  cancellable?: boolean;
  cancelLabel?: string; // NEW: Custom label for cancel button
}

Ambiente: Hardware: Raspberry Pi 5 Sistema operacional: MX Linux Impacto: Perda de tempo em debug. gasto excessivo da cota de utilizção do copilot Possíveis falhas de carregamento ou execução do frontend. body:

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Version: 1.102.2 (system setup)
Commit: c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0
Date: 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z
Electron: 35.6.0
ElectronBuildId: 11847422
Chromium: 134.0.6998.205
Node.js: 22.15.1
V8: 13.4.114.21-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

## Problem

Hi, in my org we have some internal extensions that we absolutely require developers to have installed. I found in the enterprise docs this `bootstrap\extensions` folder in the install path on the first install (and code looks like it should work for updates) of VS Code. https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/enterprise#_set-up-vs-code-with-preinstalled-extensions

I needed to test this so I uninstalled VS Code from my system, then reinstalled it, but before opening it, placed one of our internal extension VSIX files into the `C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\bootstrap\extensions` folder. However on start of VS Code, it did not silently install the extension. Even after some reloads it was not there.

I also tried disabling all extensions and then retrying but could not get it to work.

@sandy081 since you originally created this feature - are there any steps we could try to verify the issue? Or perhaps there is a regression in recent versions? 

There are not any other methods for us to force users to have our extensions installed (we have Intune for system install of VS Code but Intune is terrible software and it always fails to run `code --install-extensions` command so we can't force install extensions using that method. We asked Microsoft for support and they said oh yeah that doesn't work and refused to elaborate). So we really need this feature to work...

Thanks!

title: Feature Request: Center Activity Bar Icons When Positioned on Top

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: workbench-views
labels.description: Workbench view issues

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

When setting the `Activity Bar` to be aligned at the top of the window (via `View → Appearance → Activity Bar Position → Top`), the icons remain left-aligned. There is currently no setting or CSS override that allows centering these icons.

This would be especially helpful for minimal themes and centered layouts. Ideal behavior would be:

- A setting like `"activityBar.iconAlignment": "center"` (default: `"start"`)
- Or auto-centering when the bar is horizontally oriented

Thanks!

title: `lm.invokeTool` confirmation dialog should allow changing auto confirm
body: We're working on a tool for connecting the MCP to an existing browser, which is invoked by our extension as part of a test run. Ideally, this tool is auto-confirmed so the user isn't bombarded with confirmation dialogs. The UIfor that UI is only visible in Copilot UI though, not in the confirmation dialog. This makes it hard to discover. It'd be good if the [confirmation dialog](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/50bb1f1dd4bbd712ca969cc5950ea7b348c1140f/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/languageModelToolsService.ts#L303) would show "Always allow", "Allow in workspace" etc. I'm open to contribute a PR for this.

body:
Hi Team,
 
I am working on implementing a enterprise visual studio code offering within my organization. As a part of it I am configuring a Policy to allow extensions as per - https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/enterprise#_configure-allowed-extensions
 
If I try to block any one extension using the Policy Value 
{
"Publisher.Extension": false,
}
 
it blocks all extensions.
 
But what I am trying to achieve is to allow all extensions except 'Publisher.Extension'.
 
In order to allow all extensions I need to enter the value for the policy like below which includes all publishers:
{
"microsoft": true,
"github": true,
"PublisherA": true,
"PublisherZ": true,
"Publisher": true,
"Publisher.extension": false,
}
 
And my allowed list will be huge and will be difficult to maintain.
 
I need help in configuring policies to only block a specific extension without explicitly mentioning allowed publisher in policy value.
 
Please help

I have created a MS Ticket [TrackingID#2507220050001727] for the same. There it is suggested to report the request\issue here in github.

title: Add `preventUnchangedSave`/`skipSaveIfUnchanged` attribute

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: file-io
labels.description: File I/O

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I am using Django, and when I save using CTRL + S as a precaution in case I haven't saved something, it reloads the page, even when there are no changes to save.
I propose a new attribute that checks this and does not save if it is true. These are the attribute names I propose: `preventUnchangedSave`, `skipSaveIfUnchanged`.

title: QuickTree API - SCM adoption feedback
body: Testing #258333 This milestone we introduced the concept of a parent/child relationship for source control providers (repository/sumodule, repository/worktree) so it was a perfect timing for me to try out this new API and see if I can take advantage of it to better represent the parent/child relationship in the reposiory picker used in the Source Control Graph view. Here is the feedback that I have collected during the attempted adoption: * `setItemTree()` is not consistent with the `IQuickPick` API that uses `items` * One should be able to use a separator item * Add support for single selection (do not render checkboxes) * If none of the items have parents do not indent the items: * Add an option to disable collapsing (in this case we should probably not render the twistie and the guide lines) * With a list the keyboard up/down moves the selection, which with the tree is moves the focus. Should these be consistent? * The distance between the twistie and checkbox seems too big comparent to the distance between the twistie and the label in the tree

title: Saving files, deleting files, copying files all take a very long time or there is no response
body:
Type: Bug ### **Issue Title:** Severe Performance Issues and Freezing on Basic File Operations (Save, Delete, Copy) in a Clean Install ### **Issue Body :** **Version:** 1.101.2 (also occurs on the latest version) **OS:** Windows 11 (24H2 26100.4770) date:2025/2/5 I am experiencing a critical issue that has made VS Code completely unusable for my work. Basic file operations such as saving, deleting, and copying files take an extremely long time and cause the entire editor to freeze. This problem persists even on a completely clean installation of VS Code with no extensions and no custom settings. **Steps to Reproduce:** 1. Perform a clean uninstall of VS Code, including removing user data directories (`.vscode`, etc.). 2. Install a fresh copy of VS Code (I have tested both the latest version and an older version, 1.101.2). 3. Do not install any extensions. 4. Do not log in to sync settings. Ensure `settings.json` is an empty object (`{}`). 5. Open any project (especially a JavaScript/TypeScript project). 6. Try to perform any of the following actions: * Save a file. * Delete a file from the explorer sidebar. * Copy a file from another VS Code window into the current window's explorer. **Expected Behavior:** File operations (save, delete, copy) should be nearly instantaneous. **Actual Behavior:** All of these operations are incredibly slow and cause the editor to hang. The status bar displays the following messages for an extended period: 1. **When saving a file:** The process is extremely long, showing messages like: * `Getting code actions from 'TypeScript and JavaScript Language Features (configure).` * `Applying code action "Organize imports.` (Related to issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/233515) 2. **When deleting a file:** The process is extremely long, showing the message: * `Running 'File Delete' participants.` (Related to issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/128263) 3. **When copying a file:** The process is also extremely long, showing the message: * `Running 'File Copy' participants.` (Related to issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/132726) **Additional Context:** This issue is a complete blocker for me. I have spent the entire day troubleshooting without success. My troubleshooting steps include: * Completely uninstalling and reinstalling VS Code multiple times. * Testing both the latest stable version and the May 2024 release (1.101.2). * Ensuring **zero extensions** are installed. * Ensuring my `settings.json` is empty and I am not signed in to an account for settings sync. * Rebooting my computer multiple times. The problem persists on what should be a completely "vanilla" VS Code instance. It seems something fundamental is broken. At this point, VS Code is failing at tasks more basic than a simple text editor, making it impossible to use for any development work. I urgently need a solution as I am unable to work. title: Github billing closed workspace killed everything In VS code I deleted everything I did in the last 48 hours simply because I needed an upgrade
body:
Type: Performance Issue So I was operating the code space from GitHub or whatever I guess Or it was attached to my VS code or something I don't know exactly how it was this should stuff works. Anyway damn I was working for two days straight the side of some naps and had my project pretty much completed and I was working on pushing it to linode And apparently I ran out something for GitHub and I had to upgrade it but it killed the whole code space and everything that I was working on is now lost completely and all I had to do is just upgrade over in Github to the $4 plan and I was back But everything I worked on in the last 48 hours is gone and I had augment looking for it but it couldn't find like anything like I basically lost the last 48 hours which is pretty much everything simply because I had AG upgraders or I had to go upgrade in github. But it completely terminated that code space or workspace or whatever it is or was that I completely killed it terminated it deleted everything meanwhile the whole time I guess assuming that it was like auto saving or something somewhere but literally cannot find anything anywhere of that conversation with the chat with Augment any logs of all the changes in it stuff that it did I mean I lost everything. Like how did I go On this project for pretty much 48 hours straight and not once did it save anywhere They didn't save anything nothing at all You don't have any idea how depressing and bad this is. title: GitHub Copilot Command List UI is Cluttered—Needs Category Filtering and Improved Organization
body: Type: Feature Request When users type "/" to open the command list in GitHub Copilot, the resulting menu is cluttered and difficult to navigate. It mixes built-in commands, extension commands, MCP elicitations, and user-defined prompt files all in one long, unorganized list. This makes it hard for users to quickly find the command they need, especially as the number of available commands grows. Suggestions for improvement: Add clear category headers or tabs (e.g., Built-in, Extensions, MCP, User Prompts) to separate different types of commands. Allow users to filter or search commands by category. Provide shortcuts or syntax to directly reference a specific category (e.g., "/ext" for extensions). Consider collapsible sections or a hierarchical view for better scalability. Optionally, allow users to customize which categories are shown or hidden. Optimizing the command list UI will greatly improve usability and efficiency for users working with GitHub Copilot, especially in complex environments with many commands and custom prompts. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.103.0-insider (972d323165139d47d934dd64230f6aec7e19b18a, 2025-07-30T05:03:35.746Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

title: Allow stop editing all currently editable cells

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Issues identified as good for first-time contributors

labels.name: verification-needed
labels.description: Verification of issue is requested

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Currently we are able to stop editing current cell (by running command **Notebook: Stop Editing Cell** from the command palette or by pressing the **Escape** key) but it is not possible to stop editing all currently being in editable mode cells at the same time.

I usually have many Markdown cells in editable mode (for example to copy&paste content from one notebook to another) and I'm forced to re-visit each one to stop the editable mode (to see the formatted Markdown).

It would be great to have the option to exit editable mode for all cells at a time.
